001package io.github.ai4ci.abm.policy;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakState;
004import io.github.ai4ci.util.Binomial;
005
006/**
007 * Interface for defining policy activation triggers based on outbreak state
008 * metrics.
009 *
010 * <p>
011 * Triggers provide a mechanism for policy models to evaluate when to activate
012 * or deactivate interventions based on real-time epidemiological data. Each
013 * trigger encapsulates a specific outbreak metric that can be monitored for
014 * policy decisions.
015 *
016 * <h2>Usage Context</h2>
017 * <p>
018 * Triggers are primarily used by policy state machines like
019 * {@link ReactiveLockdown} to determine when to transition between policy
020 * states based on threshold comparisons.
021 *
022 * <h2>Statistical Foundation</h2>
023 * <p>
024 * All triggers return {@link Binomial} distributions, enabling statistical
025 * confidence evaluations for policy decisions. This allows policies to make
026 * decisions with specified confidence levels (e.g., 95% confidence) rather than
027 * relying on point estimates that may be influenced by random fluctuations.
028 *
029 * @see ReactiveLockdown
030 * @see Binomial
031 * @see OutbreakState
032 */
033public interface Trigger {
034
035        /**
036         * Predefined trigger implementations for common outbreak metrics used in
037         * policy decisions.
038         *
039         * <p>
040         * These enum values provide ready-to-use triggers for the most commonly
041         * monitored epidemiological indicators in outbreak response policies.
042         */
043        static enum Value implements Trigger {
044
045                /**
046                 * Trigger based on overall test positivity rate across all testing types.
047                 *
048                 * <p>
049                 * This trigger monitors the proportion of positive tests among all tests
050                 * conducted, providing a general measure of outbreak prevalence in the
051                 * tested population.
052                 *
053                 * <p>
054                 * <b>Use Case:</b> General outbreak monitoring and broad policy decisions
055                 */
056                TEST_POSITIVITY {
057                        @Override
058                        public Binomial select(OutbreakState state) {
059                                return state.getPresumedTestPositivity();
060                        }
061                },
062
063                /**
064                 * Trigger based on screening test positivity rate from routine
065                 * asymptomatic testing.
066                 *
067                 * <p>
068                 * This trigger specifically monitors positivity rates from screening
069                 * programs targeting asymptomatic individuals, which may provide earlier
070                 * detection of outbreak spread before symptomatic cases emerge.
071                 *
072                 * <p>
073                 * <b>Use Case:</b> Early outbreak detection and proactive policy
074                 * activation
075                 */
076                SCREENING_TEST_POSITIVITY {
077                        @Override
078                        public Binomial select(OutbreakState state) {
079                                return state.getScreeningTestPositivity();
080                        }
081                },
082
083                /**
084                 * Trigger based on the count of positive tests (case incidence).
085                 *
086                 * <p>
087                 * This trigger monitors the absolute number of positive test results,
088                 * representing case incidence rather than prevalence proportion. Useful
089                 * for policies that respond to absolute case numbers rather than relative
090                 * rates.
091                 *
092                 * <p>
093                 * <b>Use Case:</b> Policies triggered by absolute case counts
094                 */
095                TEST_COUNT {
096                        @Override
097                        public Binomial select(OutbreakState state) {
098                                return state.getPresumedTestPositivePrevalence();
099                        }
100                },
101
102                /**
103                 * Trigger based on hospitalisation burden or hospitalisation rates.
104                 *
105                 * <p>
106                 * This trigger monitors healthcare system impact through hospitalisation
107                 * metrics. This provides a measure of disease severity and healthcare
108                 * system strain rather than just infection spread.
109                 *
110                 * <p>
111                 * <b>Use Case:</b> Policies focused on healthcare capacity management and
112                 * severe disease response
113                 */
114                HOSPITAL_BURDEN {
115                        @Override
116                        public Binomial select(OutbreakState state) {
117                                return state.getHospitalisationRate();
118                        }
119                }
120
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * Selects the binomial distribution representing the current outbreak metric
125         * that this trigger monitors.
126         *
127         * <p>
128         * The returned binomial distribution can be used for statistical comparisons
129         * against policy thresholds with specified confidence levels.
130         *
131         * @param state the current outbreak state containing epidemiological data
132         * @return a binomial distribution representing the monitored outbreak metric
133         */
134        Binomial select(OutbreakState state);
135
136}
